title: ESP32 with LoRa
description: A 20-question quiz to test your knowledge of using ESP32 with LoRa communication.

questions.question: What does LoRa stand for?
questions.explanation: LoRa stands for 'Long Range'. It is a wireless modulation technique designed for long-range, low-power communication.

questions.question: Which frequency bands are commonly used for LoRa communication?
questions.explanation: LoRa commonly operates in ISM bands such as 433 MHz (Asia), 868 MHz (Europe), and 915 MHz (North America).

questions.question: Which library is most commonly used to program LoRa on ESP32 with Arduino IDE?
questions.explanation: The `LoRa.h` library by Sandeep Mistry is widely used to implement LoRa communication on ESP32.

questions.question: What SPI pins are typically used on ESP32 for connecting to an SX1276 LoRa module?
questions.explanation: The SX1276 LoRa chip communicates with ESP32 via SPI, requiring MISO, MOSI, SCK, and NSS (chip select).

questions.question: Which LoRa parameter controls the trade-off between speed and range?
questions.explanation: The Spreading Factor determines the length of the chirp symbols. Higher SF increases range but lowers data rate.

questions.question: What is the maximum typical range of LoRa in rural open areas?
questions.explanation: LoRa can typically achieve 5–15 km in rural areas with line of sight and proper antennas.

questions.question: Which ESP32 communication interface is used by LoRa modules like SX1276?
questions.explanation: LoRa modules such as the SX1276 communicate with the ESP32 using SPI.

questions.question: What is the function of the NSS (CS) pin in SPI communication?
questions.explanation: The NSS (or CS) pin is used to select which SPI device the ESP32 is communicating with.

questions.question: Which antenna type is often used with LoRa for maximum range?
questions.explanation: A whip antenna is commonly used for LoRa due to its efficiency and long-range performance.

questions.question: Which command from LoRa.h is used to start the LoRa radio?
questions.explanation: The `LoRa.begin(frequency)` function initializes the LoRa radio at the specified frequency.

questions.question: What is the default bandwidth for LoRa communication?
questions.explanation: The most commonly used LoRa bandwidth is 125 kHz, though 250 and 500 kHz are also supported.

questions.question: Which LoRa parameter improves resistance to interference?
questions.explanation: A higher coding rate improves error correction, making communication more robust against interference.

questions.question: What is LoRaWAN in relation to LoRa?
options: A MAC protocol on top of LoRa
questions.explanation: LoRaWAN is a networking protocol (MAC layer) built on top of the LoRa physical layer to allow large-scale IoT networks.

questions.question: Which Arduino function is used to send a LoRa packet?
questions.explanation: To send data, you call `LoRa.beginPacket()`, then write or print data, and finish with `LoRa.endPacket()`.

questions.question: Which Arduino function checks if a LoRa packet has been received?
questions.explanation: The `LoRa.parsePacket()` function returns the size of the packet received or 0 if no packet is available.

questions.question: What voltage do most SX1276 LoRa modules require?
questions.explanation: Most SX1276 modules are designed to work at 3.3V. Using 5V directly can damage them.

questions.question: What is the role of the DIO0 pin on a LoRa module?
questions.explanation: The DIO0 pin is typically used to signal when a packet has been sent or received.

questions.question: Which LoRa setting increases transmission range but reduces data rate?
questions.explanation: Raising the spreading factor increases the time on air, which improves range but lowers data rate.

questions.question: What is a common use case for ESP32 with LoRa?
questions.explanation: ESP32 with LoRa is most often used for IoT applications requiring low-power, long-range data transmission such as sensors in agriculture or smart cities.

questions.question: Which tool can you use to debug LoRa communication on ESP32?
questions.explanation: You can use the Arduino IDE’s Serial Monitor to debug and print LoRa transmission and reception results.
